event_text: m_c was grabbed by a seagull, but luckily r_c saves {PRONOUN/m_c/object}! The kit is still left injured from the ordeal.
history_text: m_c was scarred as a kit when a seagull tried to take them.
m_c died from their wounds after a seagull tried to take them.

event_text: m_c was grabbed by an osprey, but luckily r_c saves {PRONOUN/m_c/object}! The kit is still left injured from the ordeal.
history_text: m_c was scarred as a kit when an osprey tried to take them.
m_c died from their wounds after an osprey tried to take them.

event_text: r_c dares m_c to try and swim out of camp and m_c can't possibly refuse the challenge. {PRONOUN/m_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/m_c/don't/doesn't} make it far, however, before {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} meager swimming skills fail {PRONOUN/m_c/object} and {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} nearly {VERB/m_c/drown/drowns} before an adult spots {PRONOUN/m_c/object} and comes to the rescue.
history_text: m_c died from watery lungs after trying to swim out of camp

event_text: r_c dares m_c to try and swim out of camp and m_c can't possibly refuse the challenge, but the water is freezing when {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} {VERB/m_c/jump/jumps} in and though an adult quickly notices and scoops {PRONOUN/m_c/object} up, m_c is still shivering violently from the cold.
history_text: m_c died from the cold after swimming in freezing water

event_text: m_c is hopping around in the tide pools when {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} {VERB/m_c/trip/trips} and fall onto the rocks. Thankfully {PRONOUN/m_c/subject}{VERB/m_c/'re/'s} only a bit bruised.
m_c is playing around on the iced over tide pools, slipping and sliding every which way, when {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} {VERB/m_c/slip/slips} a little too much and {VERB/m_c/take/takes} a tumble.
m_c is playing around on the iced over tide pools, slipping and sliding every which way, when {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} {VERB/m_c/slip/slips} a little too much and {VERB/m_c/take/takes} a tumble.
m_c is playing around on the iced over tide pools, slipping and sliding every which way, when {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} {VERB/m_c/slip/slips} a little too much and twist {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} paw.

m_c is jumping around on the rocks when {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} {VERB/m_c/slip/slips} and fall. The soft sand of the cave floor softens {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} landing, but {PRONOUN/m_c/subject}{VERB/m_c/'re/'s} still sporting some new bruises.

m_c found a hole in the rocks and, curious as all kits are, stuck {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} paw inside. The whole camp comes running when {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} {VERB/m_c/screech/screeches} in pain. It seems a snake was living in that hole.
history_text: m_c gained a scar after a snake bit them.
m_c died from a snake bite.
